result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicole Lynn Slaviero

records.addlTxt: State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
10:36 AM Defendant Nicole Lynn Slaviero in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Nicole Lynn Slaviero.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Rosenthal states defendant waives preliminary in 22CF342 and 22CF378. Defendant freely and voluntarily waives right to preliminary hearing. Court accepts defendant's waiver of preliminary hearing as freely and voluntarily made. Court binds the defendant over for arraignment. Court sets arraignment in 22CF342 and 22CF378.
Arraignment scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No contact with Walmart or S.I.

3:20 PM Defendant Nicole Lynn Slaviero appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal appeared by video for Nicole Lynn Slaviero. Defendant's address confirmed. Attorney/Defendant acknowledges receipt of the complaint, waives a formal reading, enters pleas of not guilty to the misdemeanor count(s), and requests a preliminary hearing. Attorney Rosenthal asks that preliminary hearing be set this Wednesday to track prelim set in other matter. State is agreeable to setting matters together. State asks for $2000 cash. No contact with Walmart and S.I. Notes this is bail jumping and has pending bail jumping file, subject to termination of felony DJOC, and is on probation in 3 cases. Has 8 prior FTAs. Attorney Rosenthal notes client is lifelong resident of Twin Ports and has child in the area. Notes that he has had client on previous cases. Voluntarily turned herself in for this file. Defendant could post up to $500. 
Court notes concerns over pending matters and being on probation.
Court orders $2000 cash. No contact with Walmart or S.I.
Attorney Rosenthal notes that there is already $1000 posted in other case to assure appearances. Court notes that information is helpful but the bail will be kept at $2,000.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 10:30 am.
